dict.string:
Juan Perez is Vice President of Information Services for UPS, the global leader in logistics and transportation. As the Operations Portfolio Manager, Juan is responsible for UPS systems in Customer Relationship Managment, Package Operations Systems, Package Planning Systems, Scanning Applications, International Operations, Automation Systems, and Production Flow Systems. He also oversees the UPS Supply Chain Solutions Information Services group which supports Distribution, Logistics, and Freight Forwarding operations.
Juan has 24 years of UPS experience in U.S. Domestic, International, and Sumpply Chain Solutions (SCS). He began his UPS career as an intern in Los Angeles, CA, and has had numerous assignments of increasing responsibility across multiple UPS business units in operations, industrial engineering, quality, and technology. He has also held assignments in the corportate and region Industrial Engineering function. In 1997, Juan was a key member of the group that defined the foundation for the operational technology tools and strategies used today to facilitate driver dispatch, package delivery operations, and many technology-enabled services.
In 2011, Juan was named SCS IT Portfolio Manager responsible for development and support of global systems designed to support the customers' complex logistics needs in warehousing, distribution, service parts logistics, and freight forwarding. In 2012, Juan's team completed the development of the Global Healthcare Office Services system designed to support the growing need for order-to-cash services in the healthcare industry. In 2013, Juan was recognized by Computerworld as a Premier 100 IT Leader.
Juan actively serves as coordinator for the UPS Latino Business Resource Group (BRG), a company-sponsored program that supports diversity wihtin our communities, customers, people, and suppliers. He is a senior member of the Institute of Industrial Engineers and the American Society for Quality. He also acts as a program evaluator for the Accreditation Board of Engineering and Technology.
Juan holds a BS in Industrial Engineering from the University of Southern California and an MS in Computer and Manufacturing Engineering. He also holds professional certificates in Logistics, Project Management, Business Administration, and IT management. He has contributed with several patents in support UPS' intellectual property.

Joe Wilck is an Assistant Professor at the University of Tennessee (Knoxville). He received his PhD in IE from Pennsylvania State University in 2008 specializing in operations research under the advisement of Professor Tom Cavalier. Previously, he worked under Professors Russell Meller and Kimberly Ellis at Virginia Tech. During his time in graduate school, Dr. Wilck received the Spanco, Inc. Honor Scholarship from the Material Handling Industry of America for his work in material handling and vehicle routing.
Dr. Wilck's research focuses on applying industrial engineering and operations research to solve problems from various industries and services. Currently, he is exploring effective vehicle routing when energy prices are volatile.
The Institute of Industrial Engineers – How IIE Helps You Now and In the Future

Abstract: Today, more than ever, companies have a strong need for productivity and efficiency. These are real strengths of the industrial engineer. The Institute of Industrial Engineers helps industrial engineers and IE types take advantage of these opportunities and be prepared to meet the challenge! The presentation will highlight IIE’s strategic initiatives and how the association is changing to better serve the needs of its membership.

Marty Muscatello joined CCS-Inc. in 2003, serving as President until May 2005, when he was named President and Chief Executive Officer. Since joining CCS, Mr. Muscatello has led the company to significant growth, tripling company revenues and the employee base. During his tenure at CCS, the company has been named to CRN’s List of the Top 50 System Builders three straight years, included on the 2013 Inc. 500|5000 list of America’s fastest-growing private companies, graduated from the Virginia Economic Development VALET Program, and named one of the Best Places to Work by the Blue Ridge Business Journal.
The Institute of Industrial Engineers – How IIE Helps You Now and In the Future
